properties.description: Everyone knows what a Coffee Morning is? Well at ours, you can pop in for a T or C and some biscuits (or possibly a bacon roll!!) and then leave. Or you can stay for as long as you wish. There will be newspapers available for you. If you wish to be energetic you can play table tennis or snooker. You can play chess or Scrabble. Or, you can find a quiet corner and just sit and chill. The space is there for you to be comfortable. We also have plenty of folk on hand who would be happy to chat on any topic under the sun. This is why our Coffee Morning has a PLUS.

properties.description: Swansea MAD is a grassroots, anti-poverty, anti-racist, pro-equality, pro-environmental, inclusive youth and community charity. We work for a fair world in which people can be themselves and thrive! Swansea MAD develops inclusive safe spaces for people to access advocacy, creative arts, education, digital access, employability support, training, campaigning activities and projects to bring fairness and belonging and to influence change for the better. Swansea MAD is part of the Swansea Spaces scheme as a local drop-in Warm Welcome hub, supporting and welcoming people to free food, hot drinks, toiletries, period products, charging points, SIM cards, digital devices and data (and training and support on how to use them). We also provide information and support about energy tariffs and efficiency and support people to register for the Priority Services Register. Swansea MAD also hosts food event every month, where everyone is welcome to share a hot meal and have a chat. Connect with us on our social media platforms to know the dates.

Matt's Café Matt's Café is a cafe that intercepts food waste and operate on a pay as you feel basis, meaning that if you cannot afford to pay you are treated equally and can access a meal no matter what your budget is, a donation is not required. Hot home-cooked style food (takeaways available but please bring your own container): Monday and Tuesday, 11.30am - 1.45pm; Sundays, 7.00pm - 8.45pm; Matt's Café is also a warm and welcoming Swansea Space . ; https://www.instagram.com/mattscafesa1/ , https://www.facebook.com/mattscafesa1/ ; Takeaway ; Thursday and Friday at Zac's Place, George Street ; Free period products ; Sunday, 7.00pm - 8.45pm; Monday, 11.30am - 1.45pm; Tuesday, 11.30am - 1.45pm; Free period products available in basket near the front door and in women's toilets. Dignity packs are available from reception on Tuesdays including period products, socks, underwear, deodorant, toothbrush. On Mondays and Tuesdays there are also shower and laundry facilities available (referral only), plus friendly advocacy and support from other professional organisations. Everything is free of charge on a pay-as-you feel basis. Directions From M4, J47 turn onto A48 towards Penllergaer. At next roundabout, turn right onto Pontarddulais Road and follow into Pontlliw. Park entrance is on the right, after the overhanging bridge. Postcode - SA4 9EZ;

properties.description: Looking for a cosy and welcoming place to unwind this winter? Swansea Community Farm is opening its café space on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays to provide a warm, comfortable environment for families and individuals. Their heated indoor area can accommodate up to 40 people and is perfect for relaxing after a stroll around the farm. Visitors can enjoy colouring activities, games, and access to the community pantry. The café space is open from 10.00am to 4.00pm, where a hot meal, snacks and drinks will be available for purchase (except Tuesdays when the kitchen is closed). It's a great opportunity to connect with others, enjoy nature, and take advantage of this free, family-friendly resource. Toys for children / children's play area; Games / board games; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks;
